H0.text: Aseptic is the technique that refers to procedures carried out under sterile conditions in the microbiology lab.

H1.text: Personal hygiene refers to the procedures that are carried out under sterile conditions in the microbiology lab.

H2.text: Experimental control is the technique that refers to the procedures carried out under sterile conditions in the microbiology lab.

H3.text: Ionization is the technique that refers to the procedures carried out under sterile conditions in the microbiology lab.

A4.text: Asepsis refers to any procedure that is performed under sterile conditions. This includes medical and laboratory techniques (such as with bacterial cultures).
